title: Data relating to enforcement of regulations relating to underage and illicit vape sales

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
We are conducting research on how regulators and enforcement bodies are addressing compliance issues in the vaping sector covering:
•	Environmental obligations
•	Under-age and illicit sales
•	Product quality and safety standards
•	Inappropriate marketing and advertising
The aim of the study is to encourage the vaping industry to ensure that they are fully complying with all regulations, particularly in light of the increased scrutiny that is being put on the sector currently on issues such as youth vaping, rise in counterfeit and non-compliant products and environmental impact.
We are particularly interested in understanding the following from Sheffield Trading Standards. If information/data is not available for all years listed, please provide for years you can. Many thanks.
1.           What new initiatives have Sheffield Trading Standards put in place since 2021 to address under age and illicit sales in the vaping sector?
2.           How many vape retailers did Sheffield Trading Standards raid due to suspicion that they were involved in underage/illicit vape sales:
-             2021
-             2022
-             To date in 2023
3.           How many illicit vape products has Sheffield Trading Standards seized during:
-             2021
-             2022
-             2023 to date
4.           How many vape retailers did Sheffield Trading Standards successfully prosecute for underage/illicit vape sales in:
-             2021
-             2022
-             2023 to date
5.           How many vape retailers were Sheffield Trading Standards unsuccessful in prosecuting for underage/illicit vape sales in:
-             2021
-             2022
-             2023 to date
6.           What were the levels of fines that Sheffield Trading Standards gave out to vape retailers/resellers who were prosecuted for underage/illicit vape sales in:
-             2021
-             2022
-             2023 to date
7.           How many staff did Sheffield Trading Standards deploy to enforce regulations to safeguard against under age and non-compliant vape sales during:
-             2021
-             2022
-             2023
Please send the information to Jordan Millar, Account Manager at JBP Associates, email: [
email address
]
Yours faithfully,
Jordan Millar

Dear Jordan Millar,
Thank you for your request for information relating to data relating to
enforcement of regulations relating to underage and illicit vape sales
which we received on 24/04/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 24/05/2023, but we kindly ask for your
patience as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please
do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any
queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

We are conducting research on how regulators and enforcement bodies are

they are fully complying with all regulations, particularly in light of

3.           How many illicit vape products has Sheffield Trading
Standards seized during:

-             2022
-             2023 to date
4.           How many vape retailers did Sheffield Trading Standards
successfully prosecute for underage/illicit vape sales in:
-             2021
-             2022
-             2023 to date
5.           How many vape retailers were Sheffield Trading Standards

show quoted sections

Dear Jordan Millar,
Thank you for your request for information relating to data relating to
enforcement of regulations relating to underage and illicit vape sales
which we received on 24/04/2023.
Please see our response to your questions below.
1.           What new initiatives have Sheffield Trading Standards put in
place since 2021 to address under age and illicit sales in the vaping
sector?
In response to intelligence and complaints we now carry out regular
enforcement operations.
For matters relating to under age operations involve carrying out test
purchases at retailers of vapes to verify both the accuracy of the
intelligence/complaints and if a sale is made the method by which the
trader operates.  We do this using young volunteers and where required
children.  We have developed a new business advice letter that explains
legal requirements that we give to businesses to help ensure they comply
prior to operations.
For matters relating to illegal vapes operations involve inspections of
suspect premises and the seizure of illegal product.  Where we anticipate
a hostile response this is accompanied by the police. We in a first
instance offer a written warning provided the business signs over illegal
vapes for destruction.
NB The provision of materials for parents and schools regarding the vaping
issue are initiatives coordinated by public health.
2.           How many vape retailers did Sheffield Trading Standards raid
due to suspicion that they were involved in underage/illicit vape sales:
-             2021  estimate None
-             2022  estimated 10
-             To date in 2023 estimated 25
NB We do not consider interactions with retailers as a 'raid' unless we
were to execute an enforcement warrant to enter premises if needs by
force.  We utilise inspection entry and goods examination powers.  The
data regarding inspected due to suspicion of selling illegal vapes (as we
do not inspect to identify if underage sales are occurring) will take us
in excess of 18 hours to pick through & accumulate as we do not
differentiate enforcement visit records by means of a code that identifies
them from many other reasons an inspection would occur at the 1000's of
premises across Sheffield. This would exceed the cost limit of 18 hours or
£450 specified in the [1]Freedom of Information and Data Protection
(Appropriate Limit and Fees) Regulations 2004 (SI 2004 No. 3244). We can
estimate a figure and this is provided above to be as helpful as we can
be.
3.           How many illicit vape products has Sheffield Trading
Standards seized during:
-             2021     none
-             2022    4,851
-             2023 to date  estimated as 21,000 as ongoing operation
counts not finalised
4.           How many vape retailers did Sheffield Trading Standards
successfully prosecute for underage/illicit vape sales in:
-             2021 none
-             2022 none
-             2023 to date  On the 24/5/2023 one retailer prosecuted for
underage vape sales, they were both retailer and physical seller.
5.           How many vape retailers were Sheffield Trading Standards
unsuccessful in prosecuting for underage/illicit vape sales in:
-             2021
-             2022
-             2023 to date
All None
6.           What were the levels of fines that Sheffield Trading
Standards gave out to vape retailers/resellers who were prosecuted for
underage/illicit vape sales in:
-             2021
-             2022
-             2023 to date
On the 24/5/2023 the Magistrates Court issued a fine of £230 to a retailer
prosecuted for underage vape sales, they were both retailer and physical
seller.  NB Trading Standards do not issue fines.
7.           How many staff did Sheffield Trading Standards deploy to
enforce regulations to safeguard against under age and non-compliant vape
sales during:
-             2021  None
-             2022  4
-             2023  4
NB These officers do not work on these matters exclusively - estimate
currently devote <20% of time for 2023.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [4][Sheffield City Council request email]
